intro: Tuberaria variabilis var. micropetala, commonly known as the small-petaled tuberaria, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy tubers underground, which serve as storage organs for nutrients. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
